overview: An anonymous man aimlessly and lonely wanders around a harbour area. After a threatening opening, the languid boredom of a day at the beach prevails. He passes imposing cranes, plays with a beetle and watches a helicopter take off. Is he about to leave or has he just arrived? Closed in by photogenic black-and-white observations and atmospheric sounds, he is surrounded by Beckett-like emptiness.
title: Passage
